concept.title: CMM support for EIR enhancements (Feature f11309-02)
concept.shortdesc: This feature enhances the EIR support by having the MME reject the UE attach when the Equipment-Status AVP in the ME Identity Check Answer (ECA) message from the EIR is denylisted. This applies to both the IMSI and the GUTTI attach.

conbody.p: In all other cases, the MME continues the attach/TAU request. For example:

li.p: Equipment-Status AVP in the ME Identity Check Answer (ECA) message is not denylisted.
No response is received from the EIR.
Diameter error cause code is received from the EIR.

conbody.p: This feature is controlled with global parameter allowProcEirFailure. By default, this feature is disabled.

When interact with feature EIR check result of Equipment Unknown to attach successfully (Feature f11309-03),CMM support for EIR enhancements (Feature f11309-02) takes precedence when both features are enabled.

This feature enhances the EIR error handling and offers a new choice of only rejecting the UE attach when the Equipment-Status AVP in the ME Identity Check Answer (ECA) message from the EIR is denylisted.
When this feature is enabled and there is no provisioned EIR or no EIR connection to send the ME Identity Check Request (ECR) message, no change is made to the MME behavior.

When this feature is enabled and the MME times out waiting for the ECA, or receives a success or an error ECA from the EIR, the MME rejects the UE attach when the Equipment-Status AVP is denylisted. For all other cases, the MME allows the UE to attach.
